content:
In MagmaOp.lean, IsDual is defined as

def IsDual {α} (Law1 Law2 : MagmaLaw α) := Law1.iff Law2.dual

That Law.MagmaLaw.iff seems to mean that this is saying, "A magma satisfies Law1 iff it satisfies Law2.dual".

So, for instance, it's true that Equation25[x = (x ◇ y) ◇ x] IsDual to Equation110[x = x ◇ ((y ◇ z) ◇ x)], since Equation110 is equivalent to Equation25.dual = Equation10[x = x ◇ (y ◇ x)].

This doesn't seem to be the intended meaning of IsDual, or the dual command.
